data: Along the eastern bank a small Indian canoe, containing a single individual, was stealing its way—“hugging” the shore so as to take advantage of the narrow band of shadow that followed the winding of the stream.

Along the eastern bank a small Indian canoe, containing a single individual, was stealing its way--"hugging" the shore so as to take advantage of the narrow band of shadow that followed the winding of the stream.
